alert.note: Alert for Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:53PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A couple of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Brunswick County through 315 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Town Creek, or near Leland. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leland, Bishop, Town Creek, Winnabow, Belville, Navassa and Bolivia. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 30 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
